transcripts.text: Here, let me get your chair for you, m'lady.  No, Neckybeard, you really don't...
Okay, yeah, thank you.  What?
What?
Why are you staring at me?
Oh, I'm just dazzled by your beauty, m'lady.  I can't believe you finally agreed to go on a date with me.
This is not a date, Neckybeard.  You told me you had something really important to tell me.
Oh, I do, m'lady, I do indeed.  Notice anything different about me?
You got a new fedora.
Well, actually, it's a trilby, but take a look at what's on the trilby.
Yeah, um, I noticed that.  It does look a little familiar.
Isn't it exciting?  I've thought long and hard about it, and I've decided to become a social justice warrior just like you!
How many times do I have to tell you, Neckybeard?  The SJW on my superhero costume does not stand for social justice warrior.  It stands for Super Jump Woman!
Okay, okay, sorry, but still, aren't you excited that I've decided to become a liberal like you?  We can fight Republicans together!  I've already retweeted George Clooney like five times!
Oh, gross, Neckybeard.  You think I'm a liberal?
Well, of course.  I mean, you're always talking about how women should be equal and crap like that.  Doesn't that mean you're a liberal?
Absolutely not.  I'm a leftist, Neckybeard.
Right, just like me.  I'm totally a lefty now.
Oh, no, don't say that, Neckybeard.  Oh, my God.  Hopefully he didn't hear you.
Who didn't hear me say what?  Oh, I heard somebody say my name.  Oh, God damn it.  Who are you?
Ah!
Pleased to meet ya.
I sure
do hate
Donald Trump.  Or should I say, Drumpf?  Hillary shoulda won.  I'm with her!
Hi, Lefty.
Um, nice to meet you.  Whoa!  Is that coffee you're drinking?  I love coffee, but I only drink Fair Trade coffee.  Did you know that Starbucks invented Fair Trade?
Starbucks sure is ethical!  No, Lefty, Starbucks is not ethical.  There is no ethical consumption under capitalism.
Well, that's not true.  I just bought a new jacket from Patagonia.  They give all kinds of money to the environment.
That's ethical!  You see what I mean, Neckybeard?  Liberals are not leftists.  They're perfectly fine with capitalist exploitation.
But Patagonia does give a lot of money to the environment.  I saw it on Vox.

Yes, but they also exploit workers, Nickybeard.  I mean, it's great that they give some of their money to charity and get pretty huge tax write-offs in the process, by the way, but that doesn't excuse the theft of labor value from employees.  As long as companies like Patagonia are robbing workers of labor value, they are part of the destructive system of capitalism.
Well, still, it's better to buy a backpack from Patagonia than from a more evil corporation, right?  And doesn't that help a little?

Well, not really in the grand scheme of things.  What you're describing is lifestylism, the belief that individual lifestyle and consumer choices can affect the bigger system.  What liberals don't understand is that there just is no ethical consumption under capitalism.
Well, wait, doesn't non-compete, the channel this video is produced by, sell things like t-shirts and stickers?

Well, I was really hoping we wouldn't break the fourth wall in this one, Neckybeard, but since it's relevant, I'll bite.  Yes, we do sell awesome stickers, t-shirts, and other cool products at non-compete.com slash shop.  The fine folks at Non-Compete don't directly employ anyone, so they aren't directly robbing anyone of labor value, which means they aren't engaging in capitalism directly.  And they do do the best that they can to limit capitalist exploitation, like the stickers they make are printed by a small shop owned and operated by a single family, and they worked hard to find a t-shirt factory that has relatively decent working conditions, but even though the employees of that t-shirt factory are unionized and it's not a sweatshop, it's still a capitalist institution.  So when you buy a high quality, 100% cotton non-compete t-shirt for as little as $12, you aren't directly supporting capitalist exploitation, but some of the money will go to a for-profit corporation.  Sure, you'll be supporting leftist content creators and getting cool stuff at the same time, but there's no way you can buy anything in a capitalist society without participating in capitalist exploitation.
Well, it still sounds like it's better than buying a t-shirt from Walmart or something.

Well, that's not really the point, Nickybeard.  I mean, you can minimize harm with your personal actions.  You can shop exclusively at worker-owned cooperatives.  Hell, you can even make all your own shirts yourself by hand, but even the fabric you buy will be coming from a capitalist company.
Well, it still seems hypocritical for a leftist to sell t-shirts or have a Patreon.
Well, it's not so much hypocritical, Neckybeard, as much as it reflects the painful reality that in a capitalist society, we all need to participate in capitalism to survive.

Don't listen to this dirty commie, Neckybeard!  Using cameras to put videos on YouTube and then promoting them on Twitter?  All products of capitalism!  Checkmate, communist!  YouTube is a capitalist platform.

Yeah, but it's also the only platform that's available to reach a large audience.  Leftists obviously don't like having to use platforms that benefit capitalists, but living in a capitalist society means we have to use capitalist products and services.  That doesn't mean we like it.
I'm still confused.  So should I buy a Patagonia jacket or not?

buy whatever you want.  I'm not trying to discourage you for making consumer decisions that reflect your values.  Just don't live under the illusion that it's any kind of effective activism.  At the end of the day, there's just no way that individual consumer choices can have that much impact when they're made within the confines of an economic system that is inherently harmful to workers.  That's why liberal lifestylism annoys leftists so much.  We don't think it's a bad thing to buy quote unquote ethical products.  We just know that such activity alone will do nothing to end capitalist exploitation of the working class by billionaires.

Billionaires need to pay more taxes.  Reform the system, reform the system.  Yeah, reform, I was reading about that on Huffington Post.  All we have to do is reform capitalism and then it'll be ethical.

You can't reform a system that's inherently exploitative, Neckybeard.  Capitalism is rooted in a tiny class of people holding tremendous power over the masses.  As long as the workers are kept from owning the means of production, we'll never be free.  I'm proud to be an American!  Barack Obama was a great president!  See?  Liberals still cling to ideas like nationalism, and they're willing to accept drone strikes and other forms of imperialistic aggression as long as it's propelled by a liberal hegemony.  I hate conservatives!  The fact is, Lefty, there's really not much difference between a liberal and a conservative.  In fact, a lot of leftists consider them to be the same thing.  Liberals and conservatives both support the status quo, they both think capitalist and imperialistic systems are acceptable, they just disagree about how those systems should be arranged.  We need more gay military drone pilots!  More trans CEOs!  More black female prison guards!  Here we go with the liberal identity politics.
Well, I thought you loved identity politics.
Well, I do believe in intersectionality, Neckybeard, but liberal identity politics are rooted in preserving violent and oppressive systems.  Here, watch this brief educational film.
Okay.

Hello, I'm Professor Karin.  In this brief educational film, we're going to discuss the key differences between liberal identity politics and leftist intersectionality.  Liberal identity politics are rooted in preserving and stabilizing the status quo.  Liberals sometimes use the phrase, getting a seat at the table, to describe their identity politics.  The table in this metaphor represents the unjust power structures of capitalist democracy.  In theory, liberals believe that having more people from minority groups represented in the higher levels of these power structures will improve the situations of vulnerable people at the bottom.  In practice, vulnerable groups become divided as they are forced to compete for resources and attention.  What they're really talking about isn't some kind of Arthurian roundtable where everyone who gets a seat is an equal.  What they're really talking about is a hierarchy.  where the people on the higher levels hold exploitative power over the people below.  Moving up a few representative members of a vulnerable group doesn't really help the people below.  If anything, it often leads to formerly vulnerable individuals becoming oppressors themselves, and they are still vulnerable to the more powerful groups that are even higher up the hierarchical ladder.  Representation does nothing to correct the real damage that is being done by these extremely harmful and destructive systems.  A few gay, black, and immigrant senators and CEOs might have some benefit for some people from these groups, but the system itself is still inherently exploitative.  Even worse, competition between vulnerable groups invariably arises as they vie against each other for attention and resources from those in power.  Who deserves more attention?  This group, or that group, or that one over there.  These vulnerable groups are left divided as they each rally to push their individual agendas forward with the hopes of receiving much needed relief from suffering.  This leads to an eternal cycle of gains and losses for vulnerable groups as they are reduced to duking it out with each other to obtain desperately needed resources and relief which are being withheld from them by the dominant class.  Leftists, on the other hand, seek to smash the fucking table.  We recognize that capitalism plays vulnerable groups against each other, and rather than asking nicely for representation, we demand that unjust power structures be completely dismantled.  We hope to build a united front of all vulnerable and exploited people working together to tear down capitalist imperialism and other forms of oppression, and we hope to build a new system based on true equality, open democracy, and the abolition of unjust hierarchies altogether.  Leftist intersectionality is all about understanding how different forms of oppression interlock and reinforce each other, and coming together as an organized collective to construct a new system where one class of people never holds unwarranted power over others.
leftists

understand that a corporation led by a gay CEO is still a corporation that exploits workers, a prison staffed by female prison guards is still a grotesque institution of cruelty and domination, and the United States led by a black president is still a murderous imperialist entity that drone strikes the
shit out of innocent people.  Now do you see the difference between liberal idpol and leftist intersectionality, neckybeard?
Yeah, I guess that makes sense.

You see, liberals are particularly insidious because they offer false hope to people who are desperate.  They are instrumental in preserving brutal systems of domination and exploitation.  They co-opt and water down real liberation movements and sap energy away from revolutionary activity with positions of compromise and constraint where neither is warranted.
Barack Obama signed the Paris Agreement.

Liberals care about the environment.  Well, I'm glad you brought up the climate, Lefty, because it's capitalism that's going to doom us all.  Just 100 corporations are responsible for 71% of carbon emissions.  If those institutions were owned by our communities instead of greedy, profit-hungry capitalists, there's no way we'd let that kind of destruction continue.
Oh, my God!
See?  Capitalism's pretty bad, isn't it?  That's terrible!  So you agree that what's needed is leftist revolution, not liberal reform?  Huh?

No, what are you talking about?  No, I'm talking about that guy over there!  He's drinking his soda through a plastic straw!  I have to go shame him so I can brag about it on Twitter!  Are you okay, m'lady?
Yes, I'm fine.
Unhand that straw, you right-wing blowhard!
Oh no, it's Lefty the Liberal!
You're destroying the planet!  Get back here, you climate change-denying right-wing blowhard!  I think I decided not to be a liberal.
Good call.

The true facts about American capitalism's distribution of wealth and its great wealth production overshadow anything the communists and socialists have to show.  The truth about the distribution of wealth under American capitalism makes Karl Marx the world's worst prophet.  Marx, the socialist founder of communism, prophesied that under capitalism, wealth would be concentrated in the hands of fewer and fewer, while the great majority of people would suffer increasing poverty.  The fact is that American capitalism has set a new standard for human welfare.  And if we keep its basic principles strong and vigorous in the years ahead, The opportunity of every American for a still better living standard will certainly be enhanced.  And perhaps even the disciples of socialism and communism will come out of their shadowy pipe dreams and join us in our march of human progress.  At our next session, we will discuss the spirit of enterprise.  Until then, class dismissed.
